intro: Chiococca axillaris, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Chiococca axillaris is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
